page.title: 04SETTLEMENTS, CROPS & SCHOOL.
page.content: {Ingmanthorpe,}an old{Danish Settlement lies below Pratt Hall.{Cutthorpe {School,}with{22 pupils,}was built in {1884.}This{Victorian Building}is now brightly painted and is equipped with a modern computer. The{School {Field}was once a{garden}where the boys were taught{vegetable growing}by the Headmaster who founded the{Old {Scholars Association,}which is still operating. It's functions include{fund {raising}for a{Christmas parcel}for {people over 60 years}and a party for {all children in the Village.}There are {2 Farms,}farmed by 3 families, keeping {Milk Cows and Hens,}and growing{Barley {Hay and Potatoes}in this fertile soil. To the South of the main road lies the {watershed}for{Linacre Reservoir.}A bus travels to Chesterfield every two hours from{Barber Lane.
